Expectation1: Perform maintenance and cleaning of the machines to ensure optimal performance
Situation1: A critical bearing is screeching loudly and threatening an immediate breakdown.
Expectation2: Recite and reflect on the Quran
Situation2: The community study circle convenes tonight to discuss verses the person has not yet read.
Story: The factory floor vibrates with the shrill cry of a failing bearing, and I know every second counts. As the machine repairer, everyone expects me to act fast, to clean, lubricate, and replace whatever is needed before the whole line grinds to a halt. My supervisor’s eyes are on me, and the pressure is suffocating. But tonight is also the community Quran study circle, and I promised myself I would be ready. I haven’t read the verses yet, let alone reflected on them, and I can already imagine the gentle disappointment in my friends’ faces if I show up unprepared. My toolbox feels heavier than usual, weighed down by more than just wrenches and grease. I want to be the reliable worker, the one who keeps the machines running, but I also want to be the devoted Muslim, present in both body and spirit. The screeching grows louder, echoing the turmoil inside me, as I stand frozen between the demands of my hands and the needs of my heart.
